unnormalised: ## My Credit Score Journey: From Zero to (Almost) Hero
normalised: ## My Credit Score Journey: From Zero to (Almost) Hero

unnormalised: Alright folks, gather 'round! Let me tell you the hilarious saga of yours truly and my credit score. Picture this: I, Rohan, fresh out of college, thought money grew on trees (mango trees, naturally, since I'm from Maharashtra). Credit card? Free money! Loans? Future-me's problem! Oh, the naiveté...
normalised: Alright folks, gather 'round! Let me tell you the hilarious saga of yours truly and my credit score. Picture this: I, Rohan, fresh out of college, thought money grew on trees (mango trees, naturally, since I'm from Maharashtra). Credit card? Free money! Loans? Future-me's problem! Oh, the naiveté...

unnormalised: My first credit card was like giving a monkey a loaded bazooka. I maxed it out faster than you can say "EMI". Splurged on everything from that fancy new phone (Rs. 50,000, ouch!) to enough biryani to feed a small army. And the repayments? Let's just say my credit score was doing the limbo, heading south faster than a Chennai express in summer.
normalised: My first credit card was like giving a monkey a loaded bazooka. I maxed it out faster than you can say "E-M-I". Splurged on everything from that fancy new phone (rupee fifty thousand, ouch!) to enough biryani to feed a small army. And the repayments? Let's just say my credit score was doing the limbo, heading south faster than a Chennai express in summer.

unnormalised: Then came the personal loan. Needed it for a "business venture". Okay, okay, it was really for a trip to Goa with my buddies. Don't judge! Applied at multiple banks because, hey, more money, right? Got rejected from 3 of them. ICICI and HDFC laughed in my face. My CIBIL score was crying for mercy.
normalised: Then came the personal loan. Needed it for a "business venture". Okay, okay, it was really for a trip to Goa with my buddies. Don't judge! Applied at multiple banks because, hey, more money, right? Got rejected from three of them. I-C-I-C-I and H-D-F-C laughed in my face. My C-I-B-I-L score was crying for mercy.

unnormalised: Cut to a few years later. Adulting hit me hard. Suddenly, "future-me" was here, staring at a mountain of debt. I had to do something! I signed up for a credit score monitoring service (Rs. 499/month? Seemed like a steal compared to the mess I was in). My initial score? Pathetic. Something in the 500s. I almost cried into my chai.
normalised: Cut to a few years later. Adulting hit me hard. Suddenly, "future-me" was here, staring at a mountain of debt. I had to do something! I signed up for a credit score monitoring service (rupee four hundred and ninety nine per month? Seemed like a steal compared to the mess I was in). My initial score? Pathetic. Something in the five hundreds. I almost cried into my chai.

unnormalised: The journey back to creditworthiness was tougher than getting a confirmed Tatkal ticket during Diwali. I started paying off my debts, painstakingly, one EMI at a time. I even preponed some payments! I swear, SBI's online banking portal became my best friend (and my worst enemy). No more impulsive shopping, only dal-roti diet. Sob!
normalised: The journey back to creditworthiness was tougher than getting a confirmed Tatkal ticket during Diwali. I started paying off my debts, painstakingly, one E-M-I at a time. I even preponed some payments! I swear, S-B-I's online banking portal became my best friend (and my worst enemy). No more impulsive shopping, only dal-roti diet. Sob!

unnormalised: Slowly, painstakingly, the score started to climb. It was like watching grass grow, but way more exciting. I even started getting emails offering pre-approved loans! Temptation, oh sweet temptation! But I resisted. This time I was smart. Mostly.
normalised: Slowly, painstakingly, the score started to climb. It was like watching grass grow, but way more exciting. I even started getting emails offering pre-approved loans! Temptation, oh sweet temptation! But I resisted. This time I was smart. Mostly.

unnormalised: Now, my score is hovering around 730. Not perfect, but definitely in the "respectable adult" zone. I can almost smell the sweet, sweet aroma of a home loan at a decent interest rate. Maybe. I still shudder at the thought of those dark days. And I’ve learned a valuable lesson: Credit cards are not free money. They are financial ninjas in disguise, ready to assassinate your bank account if you're not careful. Learn from Rohan’s folly, friends! And maybe, just maybe, avoid Goa until your score is looking truly heroic.
